channel.title: Need to change Ip on a server
channel.description: Hi all, I am new into rs private server and i got a server, I dont want to post it or pple could take it and I want it to be unique, Its not on any website But I need to know how to change the Ip for mine, so if come1 could help me by anyway, I would like it.

item.title: Need to change Ip on a server
item.dc:creator: @anyny0 anyny0
item.description:
@anyny0 wrote:

Erm, I made in wrong section, Its going to client.

I need to change the Ip of the client for mine, I already have a server and I only need to change the Ip now.

Also, I didnt saw the Gui or Er egui.java file

Read full topic
item.source: Need to change Ip on a server

item.title: Need to change Ip on a server
item.dc:creator: @I_need_a_username I need a username
item.description:
@I_need_a_username wrote:

Lol…A server, When you Run it, Will automaticly Run on your ip…
IF you mean a Client, As in you open it and it Loads the loading screen thingy…
Goto “EGUI.Java” or “GUI.Java”, If you dont have ether Right click on what you click to open it
And press “edit” and it should look something like:
@Echo off
java -Xmx500 .;theme.jar EGUI.java
Or something along those lines
Look for after .;theme.jar and you will see “EGUI.java” that is what It loads
Then open “EGUI.Java”,or whatever it says, And you should see A bunch of numbers at the bottom
EX:
127.0.0.1, 546.265.168.124random ip btw, Or watever with a bunch of dots, Or you may see
blahblah.no-ip.biz…Just change those numbers (or letters) To your ip…
Get your IP from www.whatsmyip.org…OR if you have a no-ip Just put it there
Hit “Compile” or “compilier” and Your done

Read full topic
item.source: Need to change Ip on a server

item.title: Need to change Ip on a server
item.dc:creator: @Jddogg9 Jddogg9
item.description:
@Jddogg9 wrote:

as in?

if your using a custom client and your new to coding… maybe you should start out with a glitchy server and slowly learn how to fix the glitches. (figmentscape) but that’s imo.

if your talking about changing the “ip” of the server… you must go to no-ip.com login etc… and make a new host

then if you have already downloaded no-ip go to it and check the new ip and uncheck the other one.

is that right?

Read full topic
